attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: Placeholder text for input element provided by lit-flatpickr

attributes.name: altFormat
attributes.description: Exactly the same as date format, but for the altInput field

attributes.name: altInput
attributes.description: Show the user a readable date (as per altFormat), but return something totally different to the server.

attributes.name: altInputClass
attributes.description:
This class will be added to the input element created by the altInput option.
Note that altInput already inherits classes from the original input.

attributes.name: allowInput
attributes.description: Allows the user to enter a date directly input the input field. By default, direct entry is disabled.

attributes.name: ariaDateFormat
attributes.description:
Defines how the date will be formatted in the aria-label for calendar days, using the same tokens as dateFormat.
If you change this, you should choose a value that will make sense if a screen reader reads it out loud

attributes.name: clickOpens
attributes.description:
Whether clicking on the input should open the picker.
You could disable this if you wish to open the calendar manually with.open()

attributes.name: dateFormat
attributes.description: A string of characters which are used to define how the date will be displayed in the input box.

attributes.name: defaultDate
attributes.description:
Sets the initial selected date(s).

If you're using mode: "multiple" or a range calendar supply an Array of
Date objects or an Array of date strings which follow your dateFormat.

Otherwise, you can supply a single Date object or a date string.

attributes.name: defaultHour
attributes.description: Initial value of the hour element.

attributes.name: defaultMinute
attributes.description: Initial value of the minute element.

attributes.name: disable
attributes.description: Dates selected to be unavailable for selection.

attributes.name: disableMobile
attributes.description:
Set disableMobile to true to always use the non-native picker.
By default, flatpickr utilizes native datetime widgets unless certain options (e.g. disable) are used.

attributes.name: enable
attributes.description: Dates selected to be available for selection.

attributes.name: enableTime
attributes.description: Enables time picker

attributes.name: enableSeconds
attributes.description: Enables seconds in the time picker

attributes.name: formatDateFn
attributes.description:
Allows using a custom date formatting function instead of the built-in
handling for date formats using dateFormat, altFormat, etc.

Function format: (date: Date, format: string, locale: Locale) => string
attributes.type: ((date: Date, format: string, locale: Locale) => string) | undefined

attributes.name: hourIncrement
attributes.description: Adjusts the step for the hour input (incl. scrolling)

attributes.name: minuteIncrement
attributes.description: Adjusts the step for the minute input (incl. scrolling)

attributes.name: inline
attributes.description: Displays the calendar inline

attributes.name: maxDate
attributes.description: The maximum date that a user can pick to (inclusive).

attributes.name: minDate
attributes.description: The minimum date that a user can pick to (inclusive).

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: "single", "multiple", or "range"

attributes.name: nextArrow
attributes.description: HTML for the arrow icon, used to switch months.

attributes.name: prevArrow
attributes.description: HTML for the arrow icon, used to switch months.

attributes.name: noCalendar
attributes.description:
Hides the day selection in calendar.
Use it along with enableTime to create a time picker.

attributes.name: onChange
attributes.description: Function(s) to trigger on every date selection

attributes.name: onClose
attributes.description: Function(s) to trigger every time the calendar is closed

attributes.name: onOpen
attributes.description: Function(s) to trigger every time the calendar is opened

attributes.name: onReady
attributes.description: Function(s) to trigger when the calendar is ready

attributes.name: onMonthChange
attributes.description: Function(s) to trigger every time the calendar month is changed by the user or programmatically

attributes.name: onYearChange
attributes.description: Function(s) to trigger every time the calendar year is changed by the user or programmatically

attributes.name: onValueUpdate
attributes.description: Function(s) to trigger when the input value is updated with a new date string

attributes.name: parseDateFn
attributes.description:
Function that expects a date string and must return a Date object.

Function format: (date: string, format: string) => string

attributes.name: position
attributes.description: Where the calendar is rendered relative to the input

attributes.name: shorthandCurrentMonth
attributes.description: Show the month using the shorthand version (ie, Sep instead of September)

attributes.name: showMonths
attributes.description: The number of months showed

attributes.name: static
attributes.description: Position the calendar inside the wrapper and next to the input element

attributes.name: time_24hr
attributes.description: Displays the time picker in 24 hour mode without AM/PM selection when enabled

attributes.name: weekNumbers
attributes.description: Enabled display of week numbers in calendar

attributes.name: wrap
attributes.description:
flatpickr can parse an input group of textboxes and buttons, common in Bootstrap and other frameworks.
This permits additional markup, as well as custom elements to trigger the state of the calendar.

attributes.name: theme
attributes.description: The set theme of flatpickr.
